attributes.action: take urgent steps to ensure that members of both Houses of Parliament are resident in the UK for tax purposes and to establish mechanisms so that the status of all parliamentarians is publicly verified annually
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Members of the House of Commons and the House of Lords must be permanently resident in the UK for tax purposes and that this should be publicly verifiable. In the UK, there is no taxation without representation. There must be no representatives (elected or unelected) without taxation. 

Members of Parliament are not ordinary citizens. They can change or make the laws that govern our lives. The party leaders' publicly stated desire to clean  up British politics must include steps to ensure that all Members of Parliament pay tax in the country whose laws they make.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
